column3: > See [#22517 (comment)](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22517#issuecomment-886177699)\n\nActually, I mentioned it expecting no one will silent a temporary warning :smile:

This warning disturbs developers' workflow (compilation with `-Werror` fails).\n\nIt does not matter whether it is temporary, semi-temporary, permanently-temporary, temo-low or should just be painted in purple color.
cr ACK 83dd35260b30eaedc8822326f75c037d5e51f883\n\nSorry didn't see the warning in my patch

I don't think we need to follow every temporary change with a change to clean up warnings. If there is intent to use this function soon, I do not see the point of merging an intermediate PR that removes it just to be reintroduced.\n\nEdit: oh, you didn't remove it. This seems fine to me (though still I don't think we should be too busybody about this).
cr ACK 787296eb6744b15ab693c053e4030ff68dfc95e0\n\nagain my fault for not noticing the compiler warning in the initial patch

nit: wouldn't it be easier to just:

```suggestion
            (void)(banmap == banmap_read);
```
